class upis.upi_g.UPI_G¶

Bases: object

NF_GET_LINK_PARAMETERS = 'NF_GET_LINK_PARAMETERS'¶
NF_GET_NODES_IN_CARRIERSENSING_RANGE = 'NF_GET_NODES_IN_CARRIERSENSING_RANGE'¶
NF_GET_NODES_IN_COMMUNICATION_RANGE = 'NF_GET_NODES_IN_COMMUNICATION_RANGE'¶
execNetworkFunction(nf_key_value)¶

Execute a network function in the network :param nf_key_value: key and value of the NF to be executed

getNodes(customFilter)¶

Retrieve all nodes which can be controlled :param string customfilter: optional filter.

runAt(node_lst, UPIfunc, UPIargs, exec_time, resultCallbackfunc=None, priority=1)¶

Exec remote function on UPI_R/N :param node_lst: list of nodes we want to exec function :param UPIfunc: UPI (R/N) function to be executed :param UPIargs: UPI function arguments :param exec_time: absolute time since epoch (2-tuple of second & microsecond) when the function will be executed or None for immediate execution :param resultCallbackfunc: the callback used for returning results of time scheduled function execution. :param priority: as in UNIX, lower priority numbers mean higher priority

runNFAt(UPIfunc, UPIargs, exec_time, resultCallbackfunc=None, priority=1)¶

Exec global functions on UPI_G :param UPIfunc: UPI_G function to be executed :param UPIargs: UPI function arguments :param exec_time: absolute time since epoch (2-tuple of second & microsecond) when the function will be executed or None for immediate execution :param resultCallbackfunc: the callback used for returning results of time scheduled function execution. :param priority: as in UNIX, lower priority numbers mean higher priority

stopAt(node_lst, exec_time, resultCallbackfunc=None)¶

Used to stop remote functions, e.g. loops :param node_lst: list of nodes we want to exec function :param exec_time: absolute time when the function will be executed or -1 for immediate execution :param resultCallbackfunc: the callback used for returning results of time scheduled function execution.

cleanPerFlowTxPowerList(iface)¶

Removes the TX power settings for all flows.

Parameters:iface (string.) – name of the interface.
Returns:bool. The return code:
True -- Success!
False -- Fail!
genBacklogged80211L2BcastTraffic(iface, num_packets, ipPayloadSize, phyBroadcastMbps, ipdst, ipsrc, use_tcpreplay)¶

Sends as fast as possible L2 broadcast traffic. Note that all transmitted packets are identical.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • num_packets (int) –
  • ipPayloadSize (int) –
  • phyBroadcastMbps (int) –
  • ipdst (string) –
  • ipsrc (string) –
  • use_tcpreplay (bool) –
Returns:

float. The achieved transmit frame rate.
getActive(iface)¶

Get active radio program from a particular interface.

Parameters:iface (string) – name of the interface.
Returns:string. The name of the Active Radio Program
getEdcaParameters(iface, queueId)¶

Allows to obtain the enhanced distributed channel access parameters (aifs, cwmin, cwmax, txop) used on a specific hardware queue in a specific interface.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • queueId (int) – ID of the hardware QUEUE.
Returns:

Dictionary. EDCA parameters key value pairs:

{'aifs':0-255, 'cwmin':1-1023, 'cwmax':1-1023, 'txop':0-999}

getHwAddr(iface)¶

Returns the Hardware address of the specified interface.

Parameters:iface (string) – name of the interface.
Returns:string. The hardware address.
getMonitor(iface, param_key)¶

Get one (or more) monitoring value(s) on radio / lower MAC

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface
  • param_key (list) – monitoring parameter keys [‘key1’,’key2’,...]
Returns:

A Dictionary with the key(s) and value(s) of the monitor parameter(s) {‘key1’:value1, ‘key2’:value2, ...}
getNICInfo(nic)¶

Get the radio capabilities of a given network card NIC_t in terms of event, measurement and parameter lists

Parameters:nic (upi_r.NIC_t) – The NIC specifier.
Returns:A RadioInfo object containing the list of events, measurements and parameters.
Return type:upi_r.radio_info_t
getNICs()¶

Get the list of available interface names and platforms (TAISC, WMP, ATHxK) running on each interface.

Returns:A list of available NICs.
Return type:upi_r.NIC_t
getParameterLowerLayer(iface, param_key)¶

Get one (or more) parameter(s) on on radio / lower MAC.

Parameters:
  • iface (str.) – The name of the interface.
  • param_key (list.) – a list of parameter keys [‘key1’,’key2’,...].
Returns:

Dictionary containing the key(s) and values(s) for the requested parameter(s) {‘key1’:value1, ‘key2’:value2, ...}.
getPerFlowTxPowerList(iface)¶

Returns the TX power set per flow on an interface.

Parameters:iface (string.) – name of the interface.
Returns:Dict. A dictionary with as keys the flows(pytc.Filter.FlowDesc) and values the TX power.
inject(iface, radioProgramName)¶

Inject radio program on a particular interface.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • radioProgramName (string) – name of the RadioProgram (ATH9K_HYBRIDMAC, CSMA, TDMA).
Returns:

bool. The return code:

True -- Success!
False -- No good.

setActive(iface, radioProgramName, init_param_key_value)¶

Allows to configure the enhanced distributed channel access parameters on a specific interface and queue.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • radioProgramName (string) – name of the RadioProgram (ATH9K_HYBRIDMAC, CSMA, TDMA).
  • init_param_key_value (dict) – Dictionary containing the key(s) and values(s) for the init parameter(s) {‘key1’:value1, ‘key2’:value2, ...} of the Radio Program.
Returns:

bool. The return code:

True -- Success!
False -- No good.

setEdcaParameters(iface, queueId, edcaparam_key_value)¶

Allows to configure the enhanced distributed channel access parameters (aifs, cwmin, cwmax, txop) on a specific hardware queue in a specific interface.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • queueId (int) – ID of the hardware QUEUE.
  • edcaparam_key_value (dict) – EDCA parameters key value pairs {‘aifs’:0-255, ‘cwmin’:1-1023, ‘cwmax’:1-1023, ‘txop’:0-999}.
Returns:

bool. The return code:

True -- Success!
False -- Fail!

setInActive(iface, radioProgramName)¶

Allows to configure the enhanced distributed channel access parameters on a specific interface and queue.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • radioProgramName (string) – name of the RadioProgram (ATH9K_HYBRIDMAC, CSMA, TDMA).
  • init_param_key_value (dict) – Dictionary containing the key(s) and values(s) for the init parameter(s) {‘key1’:value1, ‘key2’:value2, ...} of the Radio Program.
Returns:

bool. The return code:

True -- Success!
False -- No good.

setParameterLowerLayer(iface, param_key_value)¶

Set one (or more) parameter(s) on radio / lower MAC.

Parameters:
  • iface (str.) – The name of the interface.
  • param_key_value (dict.) – Dictionary containing the key(s) and value(s) of the parameter(s) {‘key1’:value1, ‘key2’:value2, ...}.
Returns:

Dictionary containing the key(s) and return code(s) {‘key1’:ret1, ‘key2’:ret2, ...}.
setPerFlowTxPower(iface, flow, txPower)¶

Allows to set a TX power per flow.

Param:iface: name of the interface.
Parameters:flow (pytc.Filter.FlowDesc) – Flow descriptor.
Returns:The return code.
Return type:bool
setRfChannel(iface, channel)¶

Sets the RF channel on the specified interface.

Parameters:
  • iface (string) – name of the interface.
  • channel (int) – the channel number.
Returns:

bool. The return code:

True -- Success!
False -- Fail!
